text: Draught @ Kulovy Blesk, Prague. Pours amber with a offwhite head, lacings. Aroma of malt, light caramel, green vegetables. Flavor is malt, caramel, hay, vegetables, green beans!! Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. 240815
On tap at Hobit in Ostrava. Pours brown color, lightly beige head. Aroma is malty, bit roasted and caramel. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, caramel, malty, nuts.

On tap in Pivovarska brana. Pretty decent, nice color and head. Pleasant palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lahev (Diky, diky...):Reddish-amber coloured, hazy, smalland lacy White layer, fruity (sweet dried fruits) and caramelly nose, dry bitter hops underneath; solid dry bitter flavour, light to medium bodied and relatively soft; lingering dry bitter and caramelly-fruity finish.Not bad, but not too well balanced....

Barva: tmavá, pěna vysoká, drící. Vůně přijemná karamelově kávová lehká. Chuť: vyváené plné tělo s výraznými hořkými chmelovými tóny na sladovém pozadí, hutné pivo se středním řízem a vysokou pitelností. V pozadí chmelový dozvuk a kávová stopa.

(draught) pours a hazy deep amber-brown colour with a creamy beige head. aroma of sugar icing, yeast, herbal hops, gooseberries and strawberries, quite musty. flavour is mostly the same, lightly roasted malts and yeast, with a slightly tart dark fruity finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Hobit Club (Ostrava, République-Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur de caramel avec une pointe de céréale grillée. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée légèrement voilée. Présence dun énorme col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel avec une pointe de céréale grillée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de caramel en arrière goût. (Rating #4895)

On tap at Hobit Club. Dark amber/copper pour with creamy white head. Aroma of dark toffee, butterscotch caramel, sweet buttery aromas. Flavours carry slightly more roast notes than the aroma, slightly roasted bread, a bit of butterscotch, roasted grain, slightly sweet finish. Palate is silky. Many buttery aromas but none particularly reminiscent of diacetyl, just more of a medium caramel malt galore... We had a lot of fun with the label for this beer ;)

My Bottom Line:
Subtle toffee pastry notes quickly delve into herbal hops and their bitterness in this loose but flavorful Polotmavé.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A rocky head of foam decorates the cloudy dark red.
-Drinkability is still high despite the initially high caramel presence.
-Balance is mostly achieved in the finish.
-This beers logo is hilariously awful...

On tap at The Hobit Club.
draught at Zly Casy. Amber colour, creamy off-white to beige head. Malty with robust flavours of roast malts and some spicy hops in the finish.

on tap @klub malych pivovaru. im really getting back into polotmavy lately after quite a lengthy hiatus. anyways, this was a honey colour with a lasting cream head; big aroma of tinned peach, butterscotch and burning hay; plenty of bitterness, buttered toast, pancakes and honey. highly drinkable
